Center: IAEA Nuclear Data Section, Vienna, Austria
ref: Jour: Annals of Nuclear Energy, Vol.12, p.577 (1985)
title: Neutron activation cross-sections for Cr isotopes at 14.6 MeV neutron energy

x4freetext: Neutron activation cross-sections for Cr isotopes

x4codes.hlp: Slovak Academy of Sciences, Physics Inst., Bratislava, Slovakia
Sofia, Inst. of Nuclear Res. and Nuclear Energy, Bulgaria

x4codes.shortRef: Jour: Annals of Nuclear Energy, Vol.12, p.577 (1985)
Rept: CSSR report to the I.N.D.C., No.8 (1986)
Rept: CSSR report to the I.N.D.C., No.6 (1985)

x4freetext: Sample of different isotopic composition were used (see
`METHOD`). The samples were prepared by pressing Cr2-O3
powder into plexiglass container of diameter 16 mm.
Sample thickness varied from 200 to 400 mg/cm2.
The isotopic abundances are given in %
In order to resolve (n,p) and (n,np) cross
sections leading to the same activation product,
samples with different isotopic abundances were used
and the contributing cross section were deduced
using a linear least squares method.

x4codes.hlp: Slovak Academy of Sciences, Physics Inst., Bratislava, Slovakia

x4freetext: Errors of (n,p) and (n,np) cross sections leading to
the same product (deduced from the same activity) are
correlated, their correlation coefficients are given
-self-absorption of gamma rays in the sample
Work performed under IAEA Research Agreement 3436/CF
SD:Updated to new date formats,lower case.
Cosmetic changes, codes for partial uncertainties and
data to COMMON section are added.
